Description: Body fragment of a pottery closed vessel (amphora); outside covered in black (metallic) glaze, remains of two horizontal red lines. Hard, light brown clay, Munsell 7.5YR 6/4 (light brown); few white and dark inclusions, fine mica on inside,
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 19 A, bench on west side
Curator's comments: Findspot number '19A W' scratched by Petrie.
Bibliographic references: Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 321)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.208)
Acquisition notes: Found unregistered in the Department in 2010, in a box with other sherds from Tell Dafana.
